uh, you're a Cowboys fan,

your voodoo bullshit is not

The eyes of the world are

nervous about these guys.

- Oh!
- Oh, come on.
No big, giant, ridiculous hands.

Frank, these people are the worst.
Come on, Mac. This is the salt of the earth.

These people represent Philadelphia.
That's right.

- Yeah.
- You have literally picked out
the biggest pieces of shit in the city.

I got to agree with that.
These guys are pieces of shit.

- What is in your mouth?
- Chew.

- Awesome, cool, good to see you.
- Oh, my God.

- Cricket.
- Yeah, baby?
Bad news, you're out.

- What? Wait, why?
- Well, you are literally
the worst representation of the entire city.

- Oh...
- Your nose is bleeding as we speak.

Okay, I came up portside on a horse,
and he was a little quicker than me...
that's lesson learned.
You can't bump Crick.

- I can, I have, and I will.
- Oh, God.
I have an alternate. Here he comes.

- Hey, guys!
- Oh, hey!

- Pumped for the big game?
- Yeah, baby.
Yes. Now, see, Rex represents the best

Get out of here.

- Unbelievable. I mean...
- All right, Crick, all right.

- You're the worst.
- We got to go, we got to go.
Yo, check it out. I got one last surprise.
Here you go, here you go.

- Is this a bar?
- Nice.

- Nice.
- Fully stocked, baby.

- All right.
You found the damn suit... can we go now?
E! A! G!
L! E! S! Eagles!
♪ The eye of the tiger... ♪
Yeah.
Wait for it.
Oh, my God.
No, no, no. We're gonna sing it again?

about Philadelphia.
Aw, man...
Uh, Charlie.

- Uh...
You're bleeding, man.
Uh, um. Oh, all right.

- Oh!

- Cricket!

Yes, it's me, it's me.

uh, we should probably go back

Ah, I don't want to set a

Cricket, you're back in.
We're going to the Super Bowl.

what about the waitress?

But if Charlie missed the bus,
he missed the bus.

I'm not missing a second

- Go, Pats! Go, Pats! Go, Pats!
- Whoa, whoa, whoa! Drive! Drive!
Go, Pats! Go, Pats! Oh, shit, pothole.
Oh, something kicked loose inside.

- Oh, that was bad. That was bad.
- Oh, yeah.
You're not looking so good, Frank.

- Yeah.
- You want a protein shake?

- No. No.
- Brought a couple cases

of my new Invigaron berries
to hock at the game.
Invigaron?
You're involved in that pyramid scheme, too?

No. No hocking berries

Just be meat, okay?
Well... take off your shirt, please.
It's so cold, Mac.

- And you. What's going on with you?
- No, no, no. I'm fine.

Just a little intestinal cramping.
I'll be fine.

- Oh, Jesus.

W-What's wrong with your eye?
It's, like, way worse.
Okay, I get it, I get it.

It's "Pick on Dee for No Reason Day."
Real original.
Uh, okay.
Oh, man, I got grease on my jean shorts.

All right, well, uh, all right,
there's good news and bad news.

The bad news is, the axle's bent,
and this bus isn't going anywhere.

But the good news is,
is we passed a Walmart a few miles back.
So you can go get some parts.
Oh, no, no, no. They don't have axles there.
But I can get a new pair of jean shorts.
Damn it, Frank. I knew this would happen.

We invite the wrong crowd,
and now we've got people
going on expeditions for jean shorts.

And hocking magical berries
and rooting for the Patriots?
This always happens to us.
Every single thing we do turns to shit.

And now, we finally have an
opportunity to be something,
to be winners, and we're not gonna make it.

We are never,
ever gonna make it to the Super Bowl.
Well...
E-A-G-L-E-S! Eagles!

Hi, everyone.
Welcome to Super Bowl LII.

Well, we made it to the Super Bowl.
That was easy.
Yeah, it was incredibly smooth.

All right, guys,
let's go out into the stadium,
see what we can get ourselves into.
Guys, guys.
Let's just stay in the box, all right?

You know, for the whole game,
everybody just stays in the box.
Let's-let's cool it on the boos, you know?

That's-that's kind of, like,
what we're famous for, you know?

We-we boo ourselves,
we boo the Eagles, we boo Santa Claus.

Let's save our boos,
for the team that deserves it.

And that's the most successful franchise
in the history of organized sports.

Okay. Let's just be the most respectful
Philly fans we can be.

Mac's right. Everybody,
just act like you belong.

- What? What?
- That's okay to boo.
Yeah, Dee, your eye does not look good.

Okay, "Everybody look at me,
I'm a stupid Pats fan,
making up stuff about Dee's eye."
Dee, you definitely have pink eye.
I-I don't have pink... all right.
Would a person with pink eye do this?
Would she do that?

- Boo.
- What?

- Oh!
Kickoff, kickoff.
Guys, stay positive. Stay positive.
Gostkowski approaches the football,
and Super Bowl LII is underway.
Oh, I like this drive, boys.
I like this drive.
Birds look good. Birds look good.
Frank, what's going on, man?

- Huh?
- What's wrong with you?
I just got to go to the bathroom.
We can go? Let's take a, take a walk.

Well, h-hold on one second.
They're... Eagles are driving.

Hello. Someone has been pushing
the call button. Nonstop.

Oh, that's me.
Yeah, I-I choked down some dogs too fast.
They-they didn't settle, you know?
They came back up, actually.
On the other dogs.

Yeah, we're gonna need some
reinforcements there, pal.
Can we get some binoculars up in here, too?
Oh, my God.
How did I move all the way to Minnesota,
and I'm still waiting on you people?

- Huh?
- What are you talking about?

- I've waited on you.
- I-I don't know this guy.

- No, you never waited on us.
- Uh-uh.

- We don't live in Minnesota, bud.
- Yeah.
I have waited on you back in...
Uh, you know what? It's not worth recapping.
W-What's the point?
Hey, man.
You seem a little stressed... ooh.
You're kind of frail. You need to get swole.

What if I told you there's a berry
that can handle all your fitness needs?
I'm good, but thank you.
I'm just gonna go do my job.
Oh!
I tied his shoelaces together.

This Minnesota rube, he's not ready
for your big-city shenanigans, Frank.

Waiter, run and go get us some beer,
would you?
And the kick is good.
And the Eagles lead Super Bowl LII...
I got to pee now. I got to pee now.

- Yeah, let's go now.
- All right. There's a break in the action.

- Frank, we got to come back fast. Come back fast.
- I got to go.
Oh! God! Damn it!
What's going on over there, Frank?
I got a kidney stone.
Oh. O-On the bus.

I felt a little piece of
kidney stone break off
and go through the, into the bladder.

Why didn't you tell me that
you have a kidney stone, dude?
I don't want to freak you out.
Well, you're freaking me out now, man.
Oh, shit, we're missing something.

Listen, Frank.
This kidney stone better not screw us up.
I can manage.
This ain't my first rodeo.
The P.A.T. is no good. He missed it.
Yes!

We don't see the touchdown and
then they miss the extra point?
Dee, how'd the Eagles score?

Who knows?
I can't see a goddamn thing this high up.
These seats are the worst.
You can't see because you have

a very serious bacterial
infection in your eye.

- Hey, you got new hands.
- Oh, yeah.
Oh, I like them.
Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa.
Where do you think you're going?

Oh, ding-dong here's getting honored

I'm gonna sneak down there with him.

When we get close to the field,

on a little plan I've whipped up.

No, no plans, all right?
Just stay in the box.
Guess what? No one's talking to you, okay?
All right, when we get close to the field...

Whoa. Dee.
Both your eyes are looking real bad.
Oh, yeah, that pink eye's disgusting.
So, you know what, you can go, but I'm,
I'm just gonna cover you up

so people don't know that
you're from Philadelphia.
Go. Go. Go.

L-Luxury suite? Napkins? Utensils?

We're going soft up here
in this ivory tower.
I mean, if they get to go, we should, too.

Come on, let us loose, Mac.
Unleash the fury!
I mean, how's Brady even supposed to know

Tom Brady does not care that you are here.

Guys, nobody leaves the box!
All right? And you.
Take off the goddamn shirt!
Whoa.
Oh...
What am I looking at here, Rex?
It's the Invigoron berries, man.

They're loaded with sugar,
but I'm in too deep.

I've got to sell 40 cases of this stuff

The snap is good,
the hold is perfect...
Oh, yes! In your face! In your face!

Hell yeah, another Patriots touchdown.
Tommy Touchdown coming to get y'all. Yes.
You know what? You get out, too.

- Yes.

- Yes.
All right. Tommy, Mama's coming.
I got to piss.

like, three times, all right?

And all I've got to see are
good plays by the Patriots.

- Let the man piss.
- Yeah, I got to go.

No. Every time Frank goes to the bathroom,

Piss, Frank, piss.
I'm pissing, and it hurts like shit.
What's going on with the game?

Just keep peeing. I don't know.
It's not updating.
...throws into the end zone.
Touchdown!

- Eagles score!
Yes!

The Eagles need us.

- Open your eyes.
- Sorry. Oh.

I need to get this out to Brady.
Brady's ready to go out.

He's really wiping that
sweat off with that towel.
I mean, he's really going at it.
Just squirt some out, man, squirt it out.
I can't piss no more. It hurts like shit.
You got to force it out, then.
Where's Pondy with the beer? Oh!

I'm off duty,

We are Philadelphia!

We blew it, man.

Now Brady's got the ball with
two and a half minutes left.

he's gonna score,
and he's gonna win the game.
Because that's who he is, man.
And you know who we are? We're losers.
All of Philadelphia.
We're angry, and we're mean and we're cruel.

And we act like jerks,
and now these assholes,

they can't even bring us beer

No. No, no, Mac. You got 'em all wrong.
No.
Those guys, those guys are Philadelphia.

They bust their ass every
day just to get through.

And then, on a Sunday,
they put all their hopes into the Eagles.

And year after year after year,
their team lets them down.
And they get angry.
And that anger builds into a stone of fury.
And if it could just be released,
then we could feel something different.
What?
W-Well, then, you, me, us, those guys,

the whole city of Philadelphia
could feel like champions!
Frank.
You got to push that stone out right now.

- You can do it.
- I can do it.

Do it for the Birds, Frank.

Do it for the whole city of Philadelphia,
man, push!

with White to his right, takes the snap.

He's hit by Brandon Graham.
The ball is loose.

And the Eagles have it!
The Eagles have it.
It's recovered by Derek Barnett.
Brady lost the ball.
Looks like he couldn't see the defender.

It's-it's like something
was wrong with his eyes.
Brady fumbled. The Eagles recovered.

- You did it!
- Oh, no, Mac. We did it!
We did it! We did it! We did it.
We did it! We did it!
I don't know why you care, fair-weather fan.

Fair-weather fan.
You're from Minnesota, that's okay.
E-A-G-L-E-S! Eagles!
♪ Fly, Eagles, fly... ♪

Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa,
whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa.

we helped the Eagles win the Super Bowl.

Wait, wait, wait. Wait, wait, wait, wait.

What did you do?!

You screwed it up!

Do a superstition. Frank! Pee! Pee! Pee!

Charlie!

Oh! Oh, Brady's got the ball.

- Damn it!
Are you sure this is gonna work?
Every single thing that every fan does,
at home or at the stadium,
makes a direct impact in the game.

No, you're right.
I want to help you win.
Oh, I'm getting a call.
Let me think about this for a minute.
Hey, what's up, Mac?
Hey, Charlie, what's g...
Whoa, man, what the hell happened to you?

- All right.

Brady's going to Gronk; we're screwed.
I got one thing left to do.
All right, well, you better hurry up, man.
I'm doing it. Here it goes.
He's backing up in the pocket!
He's back again. He steps up.

and it is...
batted around...
and incomplete!
And the game is over.
We did it!
We did it! The superstitions are real!
Yes!
Charlie, you did it!
You did it, you were right.

You did it, man!
What a tremendous Super Bowl.

It is still a mystery as to

What a win for the Eagles,

- We did it!

- Oh, my God! Oh, my God!
